summary.p: 34 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 43; Qurʾānic Text: Q 4:92-5:120; 10 lines per page; Dimensions: 300 x 237mm.
The fragment Arabe 325 (h) (BNF) belongs to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 43
Fragment: 4:94(92) – 5:120(120)*; заглавие Суры 6.
34 fol. 237×300 mm (1.27). Support: thick semitransparent parchment, of yellowish color, almost white on the flesh side. Writing material: black or dark-brown ink.
Collation: three quires, all sheets are bifolia.
I: H1F H2F H3F H4F H5F H6F / F7H F8H F9H F10H F11H F12H;
II: H13F H14F H15F H16F H17F H18F / F19H F20H F21H F22H F23H F24H;
III: H25F H26F H27F H28F H29F / F30H F31H F32H F33H F34H;
Text layout: 147×245 mm (1.666), 10 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: ???. Diacritics: rhombic dots in the same ink as the main text. Vocalization: round red dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – five diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text (type 1.1.1); for groups of five verses – golden letter ﻪ (hā) written over black alif; for groups of ten verses – medallions in the text line drawn in gold and colors (type 4.A.II), with the inscribed numbers of verses (تسعون – fol. 1r and 29v, ماية – fol. 3r and 31v, ماية عشر – fol. 4v and 33r, ماية عشرون – fol. 6r and 34v, ماية ثلثون – fol. 7v, ماية اربعون – fol. 9r, ماية خمسون – fol. 10v, ماية ستون – fol. 11v, ماية سبعون – fol. 13r, عشر – fol. 16v, عشرون – fol. 18v, ثلثون – fol. 20r, اربعون – fol. 21v, خمسون – fol. 23v, ستون – fol. 25r, سبعون – fol. 27r, ثمنون – fol. 28v).

Title of surah 5 (المئدة ماية و عشرون و اثنان) is written in gold, accompanied with large palmetto on the outer margin and an ornamented strip occupying the blank line space above the title (fol. 14r).
Title of surah 6 (الاعنام [...] سبع) is inscribed in the rectangular ornamented panel occupying part of the last line of the fragment (fol. 34v).
Inscriptions: on the upper margins of fol. 1r, 12v, 13r, 24v, 25r and 34v (first and last pages of quires) surah and verse numbers are inscribed.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold of the first quire; on the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (leather?).

Defects: stains and traces of moisture; outer margins of the first and last quire are damaged probably by rodents with partial loss of text in the last quire; the edges are darkened (probably damaged by fire), with parchment crumbling (especially on fol. 34).
Old accession numbers: B. 34 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r – 14r. Surah 4, verses 94(92)-175(176)*. Incipit: [اعتز]لوكم فلم يقاتلوكم.
Fol. 14r – 34v. Surah 5. Explicit: و هو على كل شىء قدير.
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Arabe 325h (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
